Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in the 1970s, including popular theatrical classics such as The Living Dead at the Manchester Morgue, Zombie, Dawn of the Dead and The Return of the Living Dead.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to Disney’s original fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty traditional one, that any educated viewer would know “A forewarned is a forearmed”. The worst thing found is the casting of the roles and that of the actors

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
